intro: Mesembryanthemum mathewsii, commonly known as the Matthews' ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant features a compact growth habit with thick, ribbed stems and small, often blue or purple, star-shaped flowers. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems. Mesembryanthemum mathewsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
